title: Couple with dog
text:
Always on the look out gor a dog friendly Pub, i found this place. Regularly go to other pubs in the area but was the first time here.

Beautiful old pub, really lovely and friendly staff and the food..... My partner is Malaysian and was convinced the chef must be asian with the quality of the Asian inspired food options.

As a vegetarian I was well catered for.

Thankyou for a lovely evening. We will be back!!

title: Slow and Lactustre
text:
I'll begin with the good points:

- the poached eggs are nice

And now the bad points:

- Nobody is ever Ever at the 'Wait to be seated sign'
- The coffee machine which normally accompanies the breakfast wasn't working, so you had to play 'hunt the coffee maker'. Today the coffee machine has been replaced by an urn of coffee. This was fine for me as I just take coffe black, but for those fans of Latte and Cappuccino, zilch.
- The buffet is light on the ground for a normal Premier Inn Breakfast.
- If you want a cooked breakfast, be prepared to play 'hunt the waitress'. She's a lovely woman, but she seems to not notice people.

title: Iconic and not dissapointing
text:
Really great experience. Such a beautiful location, you can see why the ancient greeks chose it.

Definitely a must see when in Athens!!

title: Hidden Gem
text:
Firstly, a warm welcome from the host, who was very attentive.

The food was really great and extremely inexpensive.

Non glamorous, surprisingly brilliant restaurant!! Would go again if I found myself in Athens!!

title: Lovely location
text:
Took a bus tour from Athens. It took around 1.5 hours. Total cost was about €40 each, which did seem a little steep really. Entry to the site was €8 and was included in the price. We were allowed to roam for 1 hour.

Once there we walked up to the temple ruins, which were interesting but not really any more magnificent than the others we'd seen in Athens itself.

As previous reviews have said, the location is what makes it.

There is a small cafe at the bottom of the hill which we had a drink in.

1 hour was really enough time to be there as there is nothing to do once you've seen the temple.

title: Lovely Lovely Lovely
text:
We didn't know the oublic trabsport routes and didn't manage to get an uber, so we walked up to the funicular. It's a loooooong walk and up hill!!

The funicular is €7 return. I don't think i could have walked as we went for the sunset and had had a very busy day of walking.

There is a restaurant, bar and chapel at the top, but the main attraction is the wonderful views of the city, coastline and isalnds.

It's a lovely place to see the sun set. Take some drinks or get a drink in the bar or from the street sellers.

We stayed until it went dark and this was stunning with the city and sites lit up!!

title: Very interesting artifacts
text:
Well worth a visit!! Lots to see!! Very intersting items!!

Very lovely building and grounds, right next to ths hop on hop off bus stop!!

title: Beautiful!!
text:
It was high on my list of things to do, and it was well worth it!!

Pictures don't do the place justice. Go immediately!!

title: WOW
text:
We've come a long way from the non meat option being a stuffed portobello mushroom.

I'm vegetarian, my partner is a meat eater. We both loved this place!! Food was sooooooo good and such fantastic value for money. Such lovely, friendly people too!!

I had the veggie meatball tortilla, my partner had the greek salad and Mushroom Gyros. All was great!!

Thanks and keep up the fantastic work!!

P. S, Put a sign on the main street!! You deserve fantastic trade!!

title: Soulless Stay
text:
This was my first time in Benidorm with my mum and younger sister. It isn't normally the kind of holiday I would go on unless it is to party with friends, but I will try my best to be as unbiased as possible.

Good Points:

- There are 2 pools. A large outdoor and a smaller indoor (adult only) pool. The main pool is a sun trap. There is also a pool bar open from June onwards.
- They have happy hour twice per day (draught lager and cider is 2 for 1).
- There is a mini market in the main building with a good choice of items.
- Staff are friendly.
- Rooms are well equipped

Not so good points:

- It's far from the hustle and bustle - 40 minutes walk and alot of that is uphill. I was very glad I had booked a mobility scooter for my mum.
- Breakfast is nice, but wouldn't waste your time with the evening buffet. The food was vile and the free drinks were all horrible. Well done for ruining draft Pepsi, Orange and 7up!!
- The whole place is just a bit drab. There isn't really an atmosphere. If you're a parent who likes getting pissed and leaving their kids run through corridors until all hours.... This is your place. If you go away to have fun, you won't be impressed.
- Entertainment was the least entertaining I think I've ever seen. It consisted of a woman setting up a karaoke stand and letting kids just walk up and screech whilst she danced like an idiot. I think it would be a No from Simon.
- WiFi is charged. Who even does that in 2019?!
- The gym is also chargeable

All in all I didn't hate the place because I only used it to sleep in. If you want to be close to everything benidorm has to offer then don't stay here. If you would like evening entertainment and decent food, don't stay here.

It may seem cheap for the money but you will quickly rack up a big spend on taxis if you want to leave the place, or you need to be fit!!

I wouldn't stay here again.

title: Long Wait, Patronising Staff
text:
The place is badly managed. There is no coordination between staff.

Food took an hour to come, it was ok, not exceptionally difficult to put a bit of smashed avocado on a bit of toasted bread.

Coke machine wasn't working.

The young female staff member with hair tied up in a pony tail was exceptionally rude and Patronising to everyone.

I won't be returning and I wouldn't recommend the place

title: WOW!!!
text:
The reviews do not lie. This place has been (by far) the best hotel we have stayed in out of 4 in the past 2 weeks and I would go as far to say that it's the best hotel I've stayed in full stop.

This hotel goes beyond just 5 star. The staff are absolutely wonderful, attentive, friendly, helpful and genuine.

The hotel is just beautiful, rooms are gorgeous, the pool is gorgeous and it's in a great location with some very nice eateries (including Viroth's Restaurant) in the locality.

Guests are greeted with a cold towel to clean your hands every time you enter the hotel.

When leaving the hotel at night you are offered mosquito spray which they apply for you.

Nothing is too much really.

We didn't know about the free taxi to the hotel from the airport, so they took us to the airport instead after our stay (in the Rolls Royce no less).

This will definitely be my hotel of choice when I return to Siem Reap. Please expand throughout Asia!!

Thankyou for making our stay memorable and wonderful!!

title: Passable
text:
In short this should not be classified as a 5 star hotel.

- Rooms are small
- Staff are not attentive.
- Pool is small
- Toiletries are not replenished
- Minibar is empty (hostel style service provided where you buy your drinks at the bar downstairs)

All in all pretty disappointing. After staying at the (4 Star) Pullman Hotel G just last week on my way through Bangkok to Phuket, I was expecting big things from the 5 star Amara. Unfortunately it hasn't delivered.

I will in future spend less money and stay at the Pullman G Hotel. Rooms there were much bigger and better with nicer views, staff were wonderful and (premium) toiletries were replenished daily. The po was also pleasant, around the samesize as the amara only less the infinity part (very small price to pay really for everything else you get).

Up your game or lower your stars Amara!!

title: Impressive
text:
Photos just simply don't do it justice.

Wonderful place and the reclining buddha is extremely impressive!!

title: Relaxing Dinner
text:
Such a warm and inviting place with plenty to offer.

The owner was friendly and accommodating.

A really great place with decent food, a wide selection of beers which are expertly expertly offered according to your taste.

This place is a breath of fresh air and really adds something a bit different to the city

Thanks for dinner and for broadening my musical knowledge with Al Green classics!!

title: Nice but Naughty
text:
We went as a couple to savour the splendour of the view.

Firstly, this is not the only bar in this building. We were encouraged to go to the 53rd floor to Lebua No.3. It was ok but the ambience was a bit boring. This is the newest bar in the building apparently. We paid around £40 for 2 drinks and then left in search of the famous sky bar.

We were escorted to another bar and quickly realised this wasn't the sky bar either. We had 2 more drinks at £40+ for the pair.

FINALLY..... We expressed much interest and determination in getting to the sky bar and we got there.

The view is incredible, the bar is perched 64 floors above the street below (it's a good job I had those cocktails at the other bars really). Another £40+ for 2 cocktails and er got the photos and experience we went for.

We were led out of the building not via the grand entrance which we arrived, but instead through what seemed to be another chance to make money.... The taxi end. We declined and ended up having to walk up a pretty dangerous dual carriageway.

All in all the view was lovely. Was it worth £130? Maybe not.

If money is no object then go, if you're on a budget then just insist that you get to the sky bar at all costs and don't get suckered in by each bar.

I've never eaten so many Kalamata Olives (They were free)

title: Wow!! If only all budget hotels were like this
text:
This is the beginning of my 2nd stay at the Oliver Cromwell and I must say I am completely bowled over by the whole place.

I work away 90% of the year, so I get used to staying in the likes of Premier Inn and Travelodge, which are generally ok, however, this time I am working in Chatteris for 6 weeks and this was the best value and closest to my work, so my company were happy to book me in for the next 6 weeks and I am SO glad that they have!!

The staff are such warm and welcoming people. The rooms are spacious, newly refurbished and clean and comfortable. The bar food is astonishingly good for the price AND there's the added bonus of the leisure facilities.

On top of all of this, I overhead a staff member talking about packed lunches. Upon asking at reception, my order was taken to pick up a packed lunch (of my choice), because I will miss breakfast.

I've stayed in some very nice hotels and this kind of service is really well above what I, and no doubt many others would expect of a budget hotel.

Keep up the good work!! I am very much looking forward to spending my down time relaxing in your hotel for the next 6 weeks!!

Highly Recommended!!

title: Great find!!
text:
I stayed the weekend in Minehead for work and my boyfriend came to stay with me. We came here for dinner on Saturday evening.

There was a large party of people so the service was a little slow, but we were in no rush and we accepted this. As it was warm we happily sat outside with drinks and chatted between courses.

Starter: We had 1 Camembert and 1 Fishcake starter. Both were really beatiful.

The Main: We had 1 Salmon and 1 Chicken in white wine sauce. This is what let the meal down really. Both dishes were bland and the salmon was overcooked.

Dessert: We had 1 Cheesecake and 1 Crumble. These are both delicious.

The bill came in at around £60 for 3 courses and 3 drinks each(3 coke and 3 cider). We were both very please with the price we paid.

The staff were lovely and the manager/owner was friendly, helpful and attentive.

I would go back here again but I would try another main meal.

title: Beautiful trip
text:
I came to Minehead for work and my boyfriend joined me for the weekend. On Sunday we went on the steam train, just to dunster. It was a great experience as neither of us had been on a steam train before.

We will definitely visit again and maybe do the whole trip for £20 which is very reasonable.

It was lovely to get back to Minehead to the brass band who were playing on the platform.

Highly recommended if you're in Minehead!!

title: Pretty good
text:
It's a Wetherspoons. You generally always get what you expect.

Cheap food, Cheap Pints, decent quality.

It was a nice sunny day and there are some tables out the front which was a nice area to have a few drinks and a bite to eat

title: Great food and cheap!!
text:
Came here for Sunday lunch and it was just what we wanted.

I was a little disappointed that there was no vegetarian option for the Sunday lunch, but I ordered a cheese and onion chutney sandwich, which was very nice.

The side of plates were a little Greasy and not really worth £4, but they were edible.

The lamb Sunday lunch which my boyfriend had was apparently very good.

Prices are very reasonable and the building is clean, well kept and comfortable.

Staff were very pleasant

title: Absolutely Beautiful
text:
I've seen it from the road for weeks every time I have driven past in the past few months and have wanted to visit.

I had a few hours free so myself and my boyfriend caught the steam train to dunster and then walked up to the castle.

We decided to go in and with our ticket we got a discount, so it cost £9.50 each to go in. It was well worth it!!

Absolutely stunning!! The staff who are all volunteers were well informed, friendly and helpful.

Well worn a visit!! Sadly we didn't have time to do the tours of the kitchens which I would have loved

title: Average but Pleasant
text:
I travel frequently with work and happened to be staying in the Premier Inn next door. I was going to walk up to the wetherspoons in town but it has been a very wet day, so I came here for convenience.

Firstly, the welcoming staff were lovely and friendly, helping me by telling me that what I wanted wasn't one of the dishes that weren't available on the day. Bar staff were again friendly.

Now the not so good points:

The place is clearly understaffed, however there was someone conducting an interview as I ordered at the bar. There was a long wait in between the starter and main course and I can see how this would annoy some people, especially those with children. Tge waitress asked me if I would like any other sauces with my toad in the hole with gravy. I thought this was a little unnecessary and a bit robot like, but then I suppose she's doing what she is told to.

The food was actually very nice when it arrived. This is pub grub at the end of the day. If you want something special then go somewhere else and pay a premium for it.

As for previous comments saying that the staff did nothing about children running about..... Would that really go down with parents?! Control your kids or get a takeaway and save the rest of us non children wanting people.

Keep up the good work!!

title: Wonderful
text:
Absolutely great pizza's, I would say even better than Domino's (And I'm a big fan of Domino's).

Pricey, but worth it!!

title: Tired and Dated, Very small
text: I went expecting big things. My only other precious experience of such a place was 'The Deep' in Hull and that was incredible. This place is small and disappointing.

title: Great Place!!
text: Was a little sceptical about it being in an indoor market as my only experience of food in an indoor market has been greasy spoon cafe's. However, was pleasantly surprised. Great Food and really Great Value for Money!!

title: They serve Food
text:
As someone who works away from home 5 days a week, sometimes I go out with colleagues and sometime I prefer to eat alone (There's only so much work talk that can be had)

Tonight was a night where I wanted to eat alone and outside of my hotel. I had heard that the food was decent here, so as it was near I thought I would try it, initially walking in for takeaway, but deciding I would stay and eat as it was quiet.

First things first, if you are a solo eater here, the chutney tray does not reach your table.... Obviously I wasn't spending enough to get the 50p worth of poppadom and sauces, yet the array of equally boring eating partners around me happily tucked in (the waiter with a cough probably discharged in it anyway so I wasn't offended).

Secondly.... As a solo eater, you have more time to take in your surroundings and my what a delight (slight hint of sarcasm) they are.

If you like the colour red then you're in for a treat, if you like dirty and aged red then you will not want to leave. If you like dirty, aged, gloomy red surroundings then you will almost certainly reach climax.

Unfortunately, my love for these characteristics is about as much as my love for bungee jumping whilst drinking a pint of cats urine.

Service.... Service?....... Service????...... Again, the £24 I spent as a solo eater wasn't enough to be served with enthusiasm. Waiting for drinks and generally being ignored were particular highlights of the evening, along with being hurried along to eat up, pay and vacate the delightful establishment (if you can call it that).

The food was below average, the service is better in Tesco across the road and the surroundings are what you might expect from a lap dancing bar in Neath Port Talbot.

Apart from that, I had a most splendid evening and I would welcome everyone who is anyone to try their luck here!!

title: Lovely Food, Lovely Staff and Great Atmosphere
text:
I have been here several times and each time I have nothing but good things to say.

The staff are very attentive and the atmosphere is absolutely fantastic!!

The food cannot be faulted!!

Well Priced, Honest Food, Great Staff and a modern, clean and comfortable atmosphere!!..... What more could you want?!

title: Well Made and Delicious
text: I went here on a first date a few weeks back and the food was beautiful!! My sparkling personality coupled with the lovely food and ambience of this place led to a second and soon to be third date, so if you're in a Tinder hole give this place a go and if you're not and just want fantastic food at a very reasonable price then give it a go also!!

title: Absolutely Stunning!!
text: Great Views and a marvellous construction!! Try also Giants Cave which gives a different perspective on the view!!

title: A real piece of history with a stunning location
text: The caves are very tight so not good for anyone with claustrophobia or 7ft tall. I'm 6' 3" however and managed to fold myself enough to make my way through the caves and it was well worth it!! The caves are steeped in history and the views from the balcony when you get to the bottom are simply stunning, looking out over the gorge and Clifton suspension bridge!!

title: Quaint, A step back in time
text: Lovely quaint little shops and a real olde worlde charm. There's also a great pub at the bottom which puts on a fun quiz every week!!

title: Second Visit
text:
We visited on Bastille Day as we had done the year before.

We booked a table for the 4 of us, but noticed that many people were turned away, even though there were plenty of tables free. We put this down to the staff wanting to go to the fireworks down by the ruined bridge!!

Food was lovely!! Really well cooked pizza, wine was not as good as last year.

We did not eat dessert as we were full up on pizza!!

Staff are very nice and polite, even with our limited French!!

title: Great Fun
text:
Myself and my partner went here whilst on a trip to Warsaw.

The room was well laid out and really set the scene. Some of the clues were quite tricky, but w managed to escape eventually with the assistance of the team there.

Very friendly team, secure lockers for bags and really fun to do. We thought it was going to cost 180 zloty each but it was per room, so that was a nice surprise.

We were told it is usually easier for teams of more than 2 to play, but it was equally fun with just the 2 as we had more to work out!!

title: Work event, Pleasant Stay
text:
The arrival to Horwood House is exciting and beautiful. Make you way up a long drive and you can just make out the manor house at the top. The setting couldn't be more perfect.

The house part of the hotel is lovely, with stone doorways and darkwood panelling, just as you would expect. However, the rest of the hotel and conference suites are additions and do detract a little from this beautiful setting.

The hotel has been extensively extended and then some more. Upon trying to find my room (number 236), I met a man who had actually been given a map in order to find his room!!

The room...... It was rather small, dated and a little shabby in places, but the bed was comfortable and it did the job seeing as I was only spending one night there anyway.

We had the conference buffets for breakfast and lunch and a 3 course meal at night. All food was decent and the selection was outstanding. So much to eat, I think I left a stone heavier.

The majority of my group found signal on EE to be non existent and the wifi was quite poor in the room, but good in all communal areas!!

I was leaving for a trip straight from the hotel and the manager was kind enough to let me leave my car at the hotel over the weekend (I had already called previously to ask, so I wouldn't assume!!).

All in all, the stay was very pleasant, but had I spent more time I don't think my room would have been very pleasant to go back to again and again.

Staff..... Brilliant. Food...... Brilliant!!!

title: Great Food, Nice atmosphere, Friendly Staff
text:
Myself and my partner (Who is Asian), went here on our first night in Warsaw. We booked online and received a discount of 30 zloty each. This was for the early bird menu which I believe finishes at 6.30pm, so be sure to check the website!! The meal was beautiful and the staff were very attentive.

We had arrived early, so we took some drinks in the hotel bar....... What a beautiful setting!!

As with everything in Warsaw (If you are used to pay the high prices in the UK), the meal and drinks were inexpensive

The whole meal, with 1 glass of wine and a 20 zloty tip included came to only 170 zloty, which we worked out at our exchange rate as £30.60. That was for 2 courses each.

This is a fine dining restaurant, so the dishes aren't massive, but they are very nicely made and everything was just delicious!!

Well worth a visit if you want to eat something a little bit more special that is within budget!!

title: Beautiful part of town
text:
We stay in Warsaw Old Town for the weekend of my Birthday and had a great time!!

We made the mistake of buying the Warsaw Pass (I had bought the Paris Pass the year previously and it had saved a lot of money).

The thing with Warsaw is there isn't as much to do as there is in Paris, so unless you are determined to see the 10 attractions which you can get into for free with the Warsaw Pass, or you find that you can make use of the discounts, I wouldn't really recommend.

There are lots of souvenir shops, restaurants, bars and cafe's to visit.

This is the great place for a party or a relax.

Inexpensive trip and some beautiful views from St Mary's Church Tower.

title: Beautiful
text:
Great place to go for a walk, cycle, run or a picnic.

Beautiful setting with the Kings Spa House located in the grounds, which are well worth a visit!!

The café serves nice desserts but the staff were very incompetent.

Nice for a leisurely day out and quite central!!

title: Good if you are interested in jewish interest
text:
You could spend hours in here.

There were bits I found very interesting.

This museum tells you the complete history of Jewish faith and the trials and tribulations which they have faced.

There are artefacts and interactive things to do!!

title: Beautiful and Great view from the tower!!
text:
We visited on a Sunday and there was a service in full swing. People were queuing out of the out of the door.

We had a quick look inside and climbed the tower.

The views were lovely!! There is a lift but I'm not sure if that is available to visitors..... I think there are apartments up the tower.

It's quite a climb, but worth it!! Only 5 zloty each

title: Very Nice Food. Nice Atmosphere
text:
Myself and a group of friends went here for Sunday Lunch. We went last minute and didn't have a reservation, but thankfully we managed to find a few tables underneath the pergola. I would suggest booking if it was an important event though.

The pub itself is nicely decorated and the garden is lovely in the sun, with nice shaded areas. Staff were friendly and polite.

The Sunday lunch was one of the best I've ever had. There is a nice selection of Meat, Fish and Vegetarian dishes available. My partner and I ate half of a Grilled Gurnard and Clam dish and half of a beef dinner and both were very nice.

The portion size was ample for me, but I would say that anyone with a large appetite should probably consider adding sides to the meal. This is Gastro pub style food, so you don't get heaps and mounds, but you do get food of a nice standard which is presented well!! Main dishes cost £10 upwards.

I will definitely return.

title: Lovely Afternoon
text:
Myself and my partner travelled up from Leicester to take advantage of a 'Mr and Mrs' afternoon tea voucher received for a birthday.

Bakewell is a really nice town and the shop and café is equally quaint.

Staff were very friendly and accommodating. It's hard to find such good service in a restaurant.

The food was abundant. In fact too much for just 2 people!! The quality was brilliant. Sandwiches were well filled and the cakes were amazing!! I have a very sweet tooth, but there was too much even for me (We had to take some home not to waste it!!).

I would highly recommend one of these afternoons as a gift or for your own pleasure.

Thank you for your hospitality!!

title: Long Term Business Stay
text:
I am currently staying at the Deptford Bridge StayCity ApartHotel and will be for the next few months with work.

Deptford isn't the most desirable location, but with access to the DLR (less than a minute from the front door) and a bus route right past the front door, it's easy to explore.

There are plenty of convenience stores within a couple of minutes walk, and Deptford High Street is only a 5 minute walk away, where there is everything you could need for a short stay. The Royal Albert pub is around a 10 minute walk (in a straight line) from the apartments and is nice for a sociable drink and they also serve food.

The staff at the apartments are friendly, helpful and efficient.

The rooms are modern and well equipped with a microwave/Grill, Cooking hob, dishwasher a fridge with small freezer compartment, and a dining area. All eating and cooking equipment and towels, shower gel and hand soap are included in the price.

I have stayed in one of the smaller rooms, which although quite small had everything in it. Although I do prefer the larger rooms, with a HUGE bed and separation between the kitchen/dining area and the bed area.

All in all for the price I think the apartments are great!! I would definitely recommend to anyone!!

title: Nice Location, Ok hotel
text:
I have stayed here on a number of occasions, for both work and leisure.

My first stay (leisure) was very pleasant. I was located in a room to the front of the hotel. The room was large and well appointed. Room service was average hotel quality and the staff were pleasant. Parking was an issue as there are very limited spaces compared to the enormous size of the hotel.

My second stay was recently and a few years since my first stay. The room I was placed in was in the eaves of the hotel. Small, Dark, Cramped and generally not very nice to go back after a long days work.

This spurred me on to find alternative accommodation which was closer to work and cheaper for the company. Whilst I waited for this to be actioned, I stayed another week at The Clarendon. This time, my room was huge, with a King size bed, 2 single beds and room to swing a reasonably sized cat. A bit ridiculous for 1 person to occupy really.

As with a lot of the big older hotels, some of the rooms have been renovated, but some are lacking attention. It's just pot luck to where you end up really.

The communal areas of the hotel are very nice and the breakfast selection is really quite hard to beat. The Breakfast staff are attentive and friendly.

All in all I wouldn't say that The Clarendon is a bad hotel, but I have stayed in nicer places for the money (£100+ per night).

title: Great Food, Nice atmosphere, Friendly Staff
text:
My partner and I have been here several times.

My partner is Singaporean and has said that this is the best place that he eaten Asian food since he has moved to the UK 2 years ago.

The prices are reasonable and the food is of good quality.

For some reason, whenever we have gone the place seems to not be completely full, but steady, which adds to the nice chilled atmosphere, but due to the standard it should be rammed!!

title: Great Company, Great Food, Mediocre Service
text: Shared New Years Eve with a group of friends here. It was my first time, but the majority of them had been before. The service was bad to say the least - Having to repeat orders; waiting extended periods for drinks to arrive and nobody seeming to know what was going on. Having said that, when the food arrived, it was delicious. I'd say if you're not in a hurry and; you're with a group of people who can fill those long waits in between with interesting conversation then go to this place. You won't be dissapointed with the menu!!

title: In need of TLC
text:
The hotel is tired and broken everywhere you look. This could be a very attractive and comfortable building if only the owners would put a few quid into it!!

Communal areas are decidedly better than the hidden delights of the rooms. I work in construction and have a keen eye for finishes..... Flaws are galore in this place. Broken tiles, old fashioned (not to be confused with antique) furniture, terrible shower and a TV which is vastly disproportionate to the room.... All underwhelming features of room 244.

The bed is comfy and there are the general features you could expect in an average hotel (Iron, Hairdryer, Tea and Coffee facilities etc).

Perfectly located to visit the delights of Hereford, with the beautiful cathedral just 1 minute walk away.

If you're looking for an ok cheap hotel then you won't be disappointed.

title: Don't judge a book by the cover
text:
The Park Hotel is a grand and imposing building, located very close to the amenities of Teddington. I have stayed here for a number of weeks and have been booked in up for the next couple of months with work.

The first night's stay was comfortable. Room was decent, staff were pleasant and breakfast was nice.

However, since that stay I have been left somewhat underwhelmed. The check in staff are always friendly and helpful and there are a number of the breakfast staff who are equally accomodating. BUT, If you happen to go to breakfast on the wrong day you will be less than impressed by your experience.

Some of the breakfast staff seem to care not about the fact guests have been sat for 15 minutes and not offered coffee or toast, or even the fact that there are no glasses in order to consume your the juice, but more about chatting merrily amongst themselves.

Rooms are hit and miss. Some have all facilites, some are lacking a table or a hairdryer here and there.

The hotel is comfortable, but slightly dated as mentioned in previous comments. The evening meals are really lovely and the evening staff are very friendly and accomodating. It's a relatively inexpensive stay (especially if paid by work) and the local area is pleasant.

Heathrow is quite close by and it certainly scores higher than a Travelodge, but I have stayed in much nicer hotels for the money.

title: Average Food. Terrible Service
text:
This was my 2nd visit and having had a decent (if slow) service on my 1st visit, I was willing to give the place another go.

The pub has a "wait to be seated" policy, but if you did that, you would die of old age before you got to eat a morsel. As a result, myself, my mother and my sister took it upon ourselves to find a table off our own back.

The pub is full of character and we felt quite happy with our corner table.

Once we had made our choices, we made our way to the bar to order. A slow and uncomfortably mundane service eventually found its way to us and we attempted to order. The young guy hardly knew what day it was and had to have our order (burgers with a pate topping) explained to him no less than 3 times. Anyway, we (eventually) managed to clear this complicated (Huh) combination and pay.

We made our way back to our seating area and 2 of the 3 dishes were delivered shortly afterwards. Around 15 minutes later, our table was approached by what seemed to be the only table server (all others seemed to be too busy flirting and having fun with each other), when he asked what meal we were waiting for. He was told and then disappeared and decided to set up the empty tables in the room.

5 minutes later, my burger (with pate slapped on the plate) and "gourmet" (greasy) chips arrived. With nothing which resembled a slight apology for the wait, he was off to serve whatever else was in his other hand.

Only once I had eaten half of my food (and my mother and sister had eaten almost all of theirs), was the condiment tray brought to the table. I simply had to abruptly tell the ignorant idiot to leave or he would of been wearing the condiment tray.

To cut this tale short, my advice is to avoid this pub. Go to a Wetherspoon - The food and service may be dreadful, but they certainly live up to your expectations and it costs half the price.

Awful place to which I'll never return willingly!!

title: Long Anticipated.... WELL worth the wait!!
text: Completely amazing day out!! Recommended to all. Are you brave enough for the golden gallery??....... As someone who is terrified of heights I can highly recommend it!!...... Hugely frightening, but the views over London are completely fantastic! !

title: Comfortable & Friendly
text:
I have stayed in this hotel weekly for the past 2 months. The staff are friendly and the rooms are reasonably sized and comfortable.

The restaurant sells basic, but homely food. Good toiletries and only 20 minutes by tube to Central London (Tube station is a 2 minute walk away). Would recommend

title: Comfortable, Warm & Friendly
text: Having stayed here for the past 2 months throughout the week and on some weekends, this hotel has become a home from home. Friendly Staff, Comfortable and Relaxing Rooms and a Good Location make it a good choice for business or leisure.

title: Nice Hotel, Ignorant staff!!
text:
Rooms are well appointed and clean. The hotel is nicely decorated and the pool area is lovely. I personally found most of the staff very ignorant, but then for the price we paid for the 5 days (somewhere around £70 each-full board), I was able to oversee this.

Food was hit and miss but there are plenty of nice places to eat around the hotel andf the room service menu more than makes up for this. Overall I would say that the hotel is great value for money with bars, restaurants and clubs easily accessible.
